publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in ŠorčuqStadthöhleduring T III Š 85.4

sourceDesc.p: Transcription and references have been transferred from the "Text and Reference Database of the Tocharian A Language" (Gerd Carling Lund University) (funded by the Bank of Sweden Tercentenary Foundation and SCAS).
Transcription and translation are based on .

seg.seg: ... some noble ones, mixed with ..., showing [their] love [and] affection for Bhadrā ...
... even so, (Bhadrā), having passed over the homages of the kings [and] princes, thinks: «...
... (||) In the [tune] Asitakirinaṃ || For whose sake (I have) with flowers (paid) homage to the Khaḍgaviṣāṇakalpa;
... (for whose sake I threw ... my body) from the high mountain; for whose sake I have abandoned Ṣaḍdanta, the king of elephants ...;
... by (my) wish. 1.» Turning to (?) Bhadrā, Priyasundarī (says) thereupon with incitement, as it were ...: «...
... (||) in the [tune] svarṇapuṣpenaṃ || As if gods are continually (?) falling down from [their] divine palaces ...
Die Götter scheinen(?) gleichsam von den himmlischen Palästen herabzufallen.
The gods seem(?), as it were, to fall from the heavenly palaces.
... they cause by [their] good gesture[s]. Strings of pearls they let hang down, they try, as it were, ...
... to make [their] great (wish) successful. 1.» Thereupon Bhadrā, revealing [her] heart’s wish
«... [my] eyes also (see) the good things, my ears also hear the sweet word.
... prepares ... [But] I will have a look on the others too [and] (I will) with a sharp view ... deception ... measure ...
I will have a look on the others too and (I will) with a clear view take (my) measure against deception. (cf 1012)
Aber ich muss auch auf die anderen sehen, [und] (ich muss) mit scharfem blick die Überlegung zu (meiner) Maßgabe (machen).
But I must also regard the others, [and] with a keen glance (I must make) consideration (my) measure.
... 1.» When he had heard this, Mitra said: «This svayaṃvara [is] decided, because ...
... the palaces of the kings. || in the [tune] kokāliknaṃ || Like Sumerus [made] from the four jewels they appear.

p.note: The translation is largely based on 9-10, and .
The text continues from and continues on .
This line appears to be in verse. However, Sieg's suggestion (9) that the metre is 4x14 syllables does not fit śäpsaśśäl riwoṣ klyomäṣ, which should have been 4 + 3.

śäpsaśśäl riwoṣ: Without doubt to be corrected into riwoṣ, cf. b3 śäpsaśśäl triwoṣ. The meaning of śäpsaśśäl is not clear. It appears to be a com.pl., possibly of a word śäp, and it may designate a certain type of person.
(a)sitakirinaṃ: Name of a tune with 4x18 syllables (7 + 7 + 4).
khadgaviṣāṇakalpes: A reference to the Pratyekabuddha, according to 9 (cf. b2).
yärka(nt yāmwā): Restoration after 9. This lacuna is 15 syllables long (2 syllables of pāda 1a and 13 of 1b).

noṣpeṃ: Very probably a postposition governing the genitive, cf. also a5 temik noṣpeṃ. 9 suggests "zur Herzensäußerung" (261 compares Skt. udāna-), but perhaps a spatial function like '(turned) towards' (as in the translation) is more likely.
svarṇapuṣpenaṃ: Name of a tune with 4x18 syllables (7 + 7 + 4).

ṣkitā(nträ): An unclear hapax, which 9 hesitantly translates as "scheinen". Since we also find oki 'as, as if' in the same clause, it might rather be an aspectual verb that expresses progressivity, for instance.
This line seems to start a tune of 4x18 syllables (7 + 7 + 4).

: 10 restores päśräṃ pläkyo tārśoṃ yärm yā(mmār nāñi :) and translates "[und] (ich muß) mit scharfem Blick die Überlegung zu (meiner) Maßgabe (machen)." We doubt that yärm yām- can be interpreted this way and tārśoṃ "Überlegung", 'consideration' seems to be too far from the text.
kokāliknaṃ: Name of a tune with 20/22/10/15 syllables (5 + 5 + 5 + 5 / 8 + 7 + 7 / 5 + 5 / 8 + 7).

div.p: Edition 33. Siegling's personal copy of p. 33.

list.item: a1 /// ·[lo] ṣome śäpsaśśäl riwo_ṣ\• klyo_m_a_ṣ\ : bhādrānaṃ tuṅ_k\• kāpñune [pā]_k_a a2 /// penu lāñcä_s _m_aśkitāśśi potluneyntu āsu_k _k_atko_r_a_ṣ _p_a_lt_s_aṅkā_ṣ\• a3 /// – sitakirinaṃ || ke mosanne pyāppyāsyo khadgaviṣāṇakalpes yärka a4 /// ñi _t_ap_r_aṃ ṣu_l_a_ṣ\• : ke mosanne ṣaddandeṃ oṅ_k_almāśśi lān_t\• rise a5 /// [k]ālyo : 1 || _t_m_a_ṣ\• bhādrāyä\ noṣpeṃ priyasundari śla wār_p_aṣlune o a6 /// svarṇapuṣpenaṃ || ñäktañ ñäkcyās wimāntwä_ṣ\• litatsy oki ṣkitā b1 /// arseñcä\ kran_t\• pikāryo : _l_aṅkseñcä\ hā_r_as wrokṣi_n_a_s\• skeneñc o b2 /// l tsopat_s_aṃ śl= oko yatsi : 1 || _t_m_a_ṣ\• bhādrā āriñcṣi ākāl pākraśi b3 /// [ñ]c pe aśäṃ kran_t\• wra_m_aṃ swā_r_aṃ rake klyosnseñc pe klośäṃ nāñi : yā b4 /// [_k_aṃ] s_r_aṅkā_ṣ\• : _p_alkāmār pe ālyeksacä\ _p_aś_r_aṃ _p_l_akyo tārśoṃ yär_m\ yā b5 /// [l]ym·ne : 1 || _t_am kaklyuṣu_r_aṣ mitre t_r_aṅ_k_a_ṣ\• w_t_a_k _s_a_s\• svayampār k[_u]yalte b6 /// ·[ā]ñcäśśi k_urekāri || kokāliknaṃ || śtwar ñemiṣiñi sumeri oki l[k]ā
Gerd Carling (text), Fanny Meunier (translation, commentary), Michaël Peyrot (translation, commentary)

The translation is largely based on [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 9-10, and [[Carling, DThTA]].

a1. This line appears to be in verse. However, Sieg's suggestion ([[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 9) that the metre is 4x14 syllables does not fit śäpsaśśäl riwoṣ klyomäṣ, which should have been 4 + 3.

a1 śäpsaśśäl riwoṣ: Without doubt to be corrected into riwoṣ, cf. [[A 436]] b3 śäpsaśśäl triwoṣ. The meaning of śäpsaśśäl is not clear. It appears to be a com.pl., possibly of a word śäp, and it may designate a certain type of person.

a3. (a)sitakirinaṃ: Name of a tune with 4x18 syllables (7 + 7 + 4).

a3. khadgaviṣāṇakalpes: A reference to the Pratyekabuddha, according to [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 9 (cf. [[A 18]] b2).

a3-4. yärka(nt yāmwā): Restoration after [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 9. This lacuna is 15 syllables long (2 syllables of pāda 1a and 13 of 1b).

a5. noṣpeṃ: Very probably a postposition governing the genitive, cf. also [[A 118]] a5 temik noṣpeṃ. [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 9 suggests "zur Herzensäußerung" ([[Couvreur 1954b]]: 261 compares Skt. udāna-), but perhaps a spatial function like '(turned) towards' (as in the translation) is more likely.

a6. svarṇapuṣpenaṃ: Name of a tune with 4x18 syllables (7 + 7 + 4).

a6. ṣkitā(nträ): An unclear hapax, which [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 9 hesitantly translates as "scheinen". Since we also find oki 'as, as if' in the same clause, it might rather be an aspectual verb that expresses progressivity, for instance.

b3. This line seems to start a tune of 4x18 syllables (7 + 7 + 4).

b4.: [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 10 restores päśräṃ pläkyo tārśoṃ yärm yā(mmār nāñi :) and translates "[und] (ich muß) mit scharfem Blick die Überlegung zu (meiner) Maßgabe (machen)." We doubt that yärm yām- can be interpreted this way and tārśoṃ "Überlegung", 'consideration' seems to be too far from the text.

b6. kokāliknaṃ: Name of a tune with 20/22/10/15 syllables (5 + 5 + 5 + 5 / 8 + 7 + 7 / 5 + 5 / 8 + 7).

a1 ... some noble ones, mixed with ..., showing [their] love [and] affection for Bhadrā ... a2 ... even so, (Bhadrā), having passed over the homages of the kings [and] princes, thinks: «... a3 ... (||) In the [tune] Asitakirinaṃ || For whose sake (I have) with flowers (paid) homage to the Khaḍgaviṣāṇakalpa; a4 ... (for whose sake I threw ... my body) from the high mountain; for whose sake I have abandoned Ṣaḍdanta, the king of elephants ...; a5 ... by (my) wish. 1.» Turning to (?) Bhadrā, Priyasundarī (says) thereupon with incitement, as it were ...: «... a6 ... (||) in the [tune] svarṇapuṣpenaṃ || As if gods are continually (?) falling down from [their] divine palaces ... b1 ... they cause by [their] good gesture[s]. Strings of pearls they let hang down, they try, as it were, ... b2 ... to make [their] great (wish) successful. 1.» Thereupon Bhadrā, revealing [her] heart’s wish b3 «... [my] eyes also (see) the good things, my ears also hear the sweet word. b4 ... prepares ... [But] I will have a look on the others too [and] (I will) with a sharp view ... deception ... measure ... b5 ... 1.» When he had heard this, Mitra said: «This svayaṃvara [is] decided, because ... b6 ... the palaces of the kings. || in the [tune] kokāliknaṃ || Like Sumerus [made] from the four jewels they appear.

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
b4 I will have a look on the others too and (I will) with a clear view take (my) measure against deception. (cf [[Sieg, Übers. II]]: 1012) 623


Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a6-b1 Die Götter scheinen(?) gleichsam von den himmlischen Palästen herabzufallen. 117
b4-5 Aber ich muss auch auf die anderen sehen, [und] (ich muss) mit scharfem blick die Überlegung zu (meiner) Maßgabe (machen). 189
The text continues from [[A 66]] and continues on [[A 78]].

a1 /// ·lo ṣome śäpsaśśäl riwoṣ klyomäṣ : bhādrānaṃ tuṅk kāpñune pākär|pākä|(r) a2 (yāmuṣ) /// penu lāñcäs mäśkitāśśi potluneyntu āsuk kätkoräṣ pältsäṅkāṣ a3 /// (|| a)sitakirinaṃ || # ke mosanne , pyāppyāsyo ; khadgaviṣā,ṇakalpes ; yärkant|yärka|(nt) a4 (yāmwā :) #1a %11 /// , (kapśa)ñi ; täpräṃ ṣuläṣ : #1b ke mosanne , ṣaddandeṃ ; oṅkälmāśśi , lānt rise ; a5 %4 #1c %14 /// , (ñi ā)kālyo : 1 || #1d tmäṣ bhādrāy noṣpeṃ priyasundari śla wārpäṣlune oki|o|(ki) a6 /// (||) svarṇapuṣpenaṃ || # ñäktañ ñäkcyās , wimāntwäṣ ; litatsi|litatsy oki , ṣkitānträ|ṣkitā|(nträ) b1 ; %4 #1a %12 /// arseñc ; krant pikāryo : #1b läṅkseñc hāräs , wrokṣinäs ; skeneñc oki|o|(ki) b2 , %7 #1c %9 /// (ākā)l , tsopatsäṃ ; śla|śl= oko yatsi_(TA)|yatsi : 1 || #1d tmäṣ bhādrā āriñcṣi ākāl pākraśi b3 (ypamāṃ) /// # (lke)ñc pe aśäṃ , krant wramäṃ ; swāräṃ rake , klyosnseñc pe ; klośäṃ nāñi : #1a yā b4 %14 /// käṃ sräṅkāṣ : #1b pälkāmār pe , ālyeksac ; päśräṃ pläkyo , tārśoṃ yärm ; yā b5 %3 #1c %17 /// lym·ne : 1 || #1d täm kaklyuṣuräṣ mitre träṅkäṣ wtäk säs svayampār k_uyalte b6 /// (l)āñcäśśi k_urekāri || kokāliknaṃ || # śtwar ñemiṣiñi ; sumeri oki ; lkāntär|lkā|(nträ) #1a
